page.title: 05WEST LUCCOMBE FARM
page.content: West Luccombe is a 300 acre farm rented from the{National Trust.}The farmer who rents it also owns Lucott Farm where the animals are kept in summer.He lets this farm house for holiday accommodation and his wife does bed and breakfast at Luccombe. The farmer keeps about 1000{Exmoor {Horn sheep}changing 250 ewes each year.They also keep Devon Charolais cross beef cattle which are sold at {Cutcombe}market.200 acres are arable with 100 acres{malting barley}and 100 acres mowing grass.They do not have much modern equipment because of expense only tractors are kept;other mechanical work is done by{contractors A new barley store and drying unit has recently been built.Their greatest anxiety is the uncertainty of the future of farming.
